00059 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060 // Global access to the app (needed for the global WndProc())
00061 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062 CMyD3DApplication* g_pApp  = NULL;
00063 HINSTANCE          g_hInst = NULL;
00064

00067 
00068 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 // Name: WinMain()
00070 // Desc: Entry point to the program. Initializes everything, and goes into a
00071 //       message-processing loop. Idle time is used to render the scene.
00072 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00073 INT WINAPI WinMain( HINSTANCE hInst, HINSTANCE, LPSTR, INT )
00074 {
00075     CMyD3DApplication d3dApp;
00076 
00077     g_pApp  = &d3dApp;
00078     g_hInst = hInst;
00079 
00080     InitCommonControls();
00081     if( FAILED( d3dApp.Create( hInst ) ) )
00082         return 0;
00083 
00084     return d3dApp.Run();
00085 }

00090 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091 // Name: CMyD3DApplication()
00092 // Desc: Application constructor.   Paired with ~CMyD3DApplication()
00093 //       Member variables should be initialized to a known state here.  
00094 //       The application window has not yet been created and no Direct3D device 
00095 //       has been created, so any initialization that depends on a window or 
00096 //       Direct3D should be deferred to a later stage. 
00097 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00098 CMyD3DApplication::CMyD3DApplication()
00099 {
00100     m_dwCreationWidth           = 500;
00101     m_dwCreationHeight          = 375;
00102     m_strWindowTitle            = TEXT( "SceneGraph" );
00103     m_d3dEnumeration.AppUsesDepthBuffer   = TRUE;
00104         m_bStartFullscreen                      = false;
00105         m_bShowCursorWhenFullscreen     = false;
00106 
00107     // Create a D3D font using d3dfont.cpp
00108     m_pFont                     = new CD3DFont( _T("Arial"), 12, D3DFONT_BOLD );
00109     m_bLoadingApp               = TRUE;
00110     m_pSoundManager             = NULL;
00111 
00112     // Read settings from registry
00113     ReadSettings();
00114 
00115         m_pScene                                        = NULL;
00116 }

00126 {
00127 }

00132 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00133 // Name: OneTimeSceneInit()
00134 // Desc: Paired with FinalCleanup().
00135 //       The window has been created and the IDirect3D9 interface has been
00136 //       created, but the device has not been created yet.  Here you can
00137 //       perform application-related initialization and cleanup that does
00138 //       not depend on a device.
00139 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::OneTimeSceneInit()
00141 {
00142     // TODO: perform one time initialization
00143 
00144     // Drawing loading status message until app finishes loading
00145     SendMessage( m_hWnd, WM_PAINT, 0, 0 );
00146 
00147     // Initialize audio
00148     InitAudio( m_hWnd );
00149 
00150     m_bLoadingApp = FALSE;
00151 
00152     return S_OK;
00153 }

00158 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00159 // Name: ReadSettings()
00160 // Desc: Read the app settings from the registry
00161 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00162 VOID CMyD3DApplication::ReadSettings()
00163 {
00164     HKEY hkey;
00165     if( ERROR_SUCCESS == RegCreateKeyEx( HKEY_CURRENT_USER, DXAPP_KEY, 
00166         0, NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, NULL ) )
00167     {
00168         // TODO: change as needed
00169 
00170         // Read the stored window width/height.  This is just an example,
00171         // of how to use DXUtil_Read*() functions.
00172         DXUtil_ReadIntRegKey( hkey, TEXT("Width"), &m_dwCreationWidth, m_dwCreationWidth );
00173         DXUtil_ReadIntRegKey( hkey, TEXT("Height"), &m_dwCreationHeight, m_dwCreationHeight );
00174 
00175         RegCloseKey( hkey );
00176     }
00177 }

00182 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00183 // Name: WriteSettings()
00184 // Desc: Write the app settings to the registry
00185 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00186 VOID CMyD3DApplication::WriteSettings()
00187 {
00188     HKEY hkey;
00189 
00190     if( ERROR_SUCCESS == RegCreateKeyEx( HKEY_CURRENT_USER, DXAPP_KEY, 
00191         0, NULL, REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hkey, NULL ) )
00192     {
00193         // TODO: change as needed
00194 
00195         // Write the window width/height.  This is just an example,
00196         // of how to use DXUtil_Write*() functions.
00197         DXUtil_WriteIntRegKey( hkey, TEXT("Width"), m_rcWindowClient.right );
00198         DXUtil_WriteIntRegKey( hkey, TEXT("Height"), m_rcWindowClient.bottom );
00199 
00200         RegCloseKey( hkey );
00201     }
00202 }

00208 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00209 // Name: InitAudio()
00210 // Desc: Initialize DirectX audio objects
00211 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00212 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::InitAudio( HWND hWnd )
00213 {
00214     HRESULT hr;
00215 
00216     // Create a static IDirectSound in the CSound class.  
00217     // Set coop level to DSSCL_PRIORITY, and set primary buffer 
00218     // format to stereo, 22kHz and 16-bit output.
00219     m_pSoundManager = new CSoundManager();
00220 
00221     if( FAILED( hr = m_pSoundManager->Initialize( hWnd, DSSCL_PRIORITY ) ) )
00222         return DXTRACE_ERR( TEXT("m_pSoundManager->Initialize"), hr );
00223 
00224     if( FAILED( hr = m_pSoundManager->SetPrimaryBufferFormat( 2, 22050, 16 ) ) )
00225         return DXTRACE_ERR( TEXT("m_pSoundManager->SetPrimaryBufferFormat"), hr );
00226 
00227     return S_OK;
00228 }

00233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 // Name: ConfirmDevice()
00235 // Desc: Called during device initialization, this code checks the display device
00236 //       for some minimum set of capabilities
00237 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00238 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::ConfirmDevice( D3DCAPS9* pCaps, DWORD dwBehavior,
00239                                           D3DFORMAT Format )
00240 {
00241     UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER( Format );
00242     UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER( dwBehavior );
00243     UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER( pCaps );
00244     
00245     BOOL bCapsAcceptable;
00246 
00247     // TODO: Perform checks to see if these display caps are acceptable.
00248     bCapsAcceptable = TRUE;
00249 
00250     if( bCapsAcceptable )         
00251         return S_OK;
00252     else
00253         return E_FAIL;
00254 }

00259 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00260 // Name: InitDeviceObjects()
00261 // Desc: Paired with DeleteDeviceObjects()
00262 //       The device has been created.  Resources that are not lost on
00263 //       Reset() can be created here -- resources in D3DPOOL_MANAGED,
00264 //       D3DPOOL_SCRATCH, or D3DPOOL_SYSTEMMEM.  Image surfaces created via
00265 //       CreateImageSurface are never lost and can be created here.  Vertex
00266 //       shaders and pixel shaders can also be created here as they are not
00267 //       lost on Reset().
00268 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00269 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::InitDeviceObjects()
00270 {
00271     // Init the font
00272     m_pFont->InitDeviceObjects( m_pd3dDevice );
00273 
00274         // Build the scene
00275         m_pScene = BuildScene(m_pd3dDevice);
00276     return S_OK;
00277 }
00278 
00279 
00280 
00281 
00282 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00283 // Name: RestoreDeviceObjects()
00284 // Desc: Paired with InvalidateDeviceObjects()
00285 //       The device exists, but may have just been Reset().  Resources in
00286 //       D3DPOOL_DEFAULT and any other device state that persists during
00287 //       rendering should be set here.  Render states, matrices, textures,
00288 //       etc., that don't change during rendering can be set once here to
00289 //       avoid redundant state setting during Render() or FrameMove().
00290 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00291 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::RestoreDeviceObjects()
00292 {
00293     // Set up the textures
00294     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLOROP,   D3DTOP_MODULATE );
00295     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
00296     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_COLORARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00297     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAOP,   D3DTOP_MODULATE );
00298     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG1, D3DTA_TEXTURE );
00299     m_pd3dDevice->SetTextureStageState( 0, D3DTSS_ALPHAARG2, D3DTA_DIFFUSE );
00300     m_pd3dDevice->SetSamplerState( 0, D3DSAMP_MINFILTER, D3DTEXF_LINEAR );
00301     m_pd3dDevice->SetSamplerState( 0, D3DSAMP_MAGFILTER, D3DTEXF_LINEAR );
00302 
00303     // Set miscellaneous render states
00304     m_pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_DITHERENABLE,   FALSE );
00305     m_pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_SPECULARENABLE, FALSE );
00306     m_pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_ZENABLE,        TRUE );
00307     m_pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_AMBIENT,        0x000F0F0F );
00308 
00309     // Set up our view matrix. A view matrix can be defined given an eye point,
00310     // a point to lookat, and a direction for which way is up. Here, we set the
00311     // eye five units back along the z-axis and up three units, look at the
00312     // origin, and define "up" to be in the y-direction.
00313 
00314     // Set the projection matrix
00315     D3DXMATRIX matProj;
00316     FLOAT fAspect = ((FLOAT)m_d3dsdBackBuffer.Width) / m_d3dsdBackBuffer.Height;
00317     D3DXMatrixPerspectiveFovLH( &matProj, D3DX_PI/4, fAspect, 1.0f, 100.0f );
00318     m_pd3dDevice->SetTransform( D3DTS_PROJECTION, &matProj );
00319 
00320     // Set up lighting states
00321     D3DLIGHT9 light;
00322     D3DUtil_InitLight( light, D3DLIGHT_DIRECTIONAL, 1.0f, -6.0f, 1.0f );
00323     m_pd3dDevice->SetLight( 0, &light );
00324     m_pd3dDevice->LightEnable( 0, TRUE );
00325     m_pd3dDevice->SetRenderState( D3DRS_LIGHTING, TRUE );
00326 
00327     // Restore the font
00328     m_pFont->RestoreDeviceObjects();
00329 
00330     return S_OK;
00331 }
00332

00334 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00335 // Name: FrameMove()
00336 // Desc: Called once per frame, the call is the entry point for animating
00337 //       the scene.
00338 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00339 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::FrameMove()
00340 {
00341         if (m_pScene) 
00342                 m_pScene->Update();
00343     return S_OK;
00344 }
00345 
00346 
00347 
00348 
00349 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00350 // Name: Render()
00351 // Desc: Called once per frame, the call is the entry point for 3d
00352 //       rendering. This function sets up render states, clears the
00353 //       viewport, and renders the scene.
00354 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00355 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::Render()
00356 {
00357     // Clear the viewport
00358     m_pd3dDevice->Clear( 0L, NULL, D3DCLEAR_TARGET|D3DCLEAR_ZBUFFER,
00359                          0x000000ff, 1.0f, 0L );
00360 
00361     // Begin the scene
00362     if( SUCCEEDED( m_pd3dDevice->BeginScene() ) )
00363     {
00364                 if (m_pScene)
00365                         m_pScene->Render();
00366 
00367         // Render stats and help text  
00368         //RenderText();
00369 
00370         // End the scene.
00371         m_pd3dDevice->EndScene();
00372     }
00373 
00374     return S_OK;
00375 }

00380 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00381 // Name: RenderText()
00382 // Desc: Renders stats and help text to the scene.
00383 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00384 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::RenderText()
00385 {
00386     D3DCOLOR fontColor        = D3DCOLOR_ARGB(255,255,255,0);
00387     TCHAR szMsg[MAX_PATH] = TEXT("");
00388 
00389     // Output display stats
00390     FLOAT fNextLine = 40.0f; 
00391 
00392     lstrcpy( szMsg, m_strDeviceStats );
00393     fNextLine -= 20.0f;
00394     m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00395 
00396     lstrcpy( szMsg, m_strFrameStats );
00397     fNextLine -= 20.0f;
00398     m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00399 
00400     // Output statistics & help
00401     fNextLine = (FLOAT) m_d3dsdBackBuffer.Height; 
00402     fNextLine -= 20.0f; m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00403     lstrcpy( szMsg, TEXT("Use arrow keys to rotate object") );
00404     fNextLine -= 20.0f; m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00405     lstrcpy( szMsg, TEXT("Hold 'F5' down to play and repeat a sound") );
00406     fNextLine -= 20.0f; m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00407     lstrcpy( szMsg, TEXT("Press 'F2' to configure display") );
00408     fNextLine -= 20.0f; m_pFont->DrawText( 2, fNextLine, fontColor, szMsg );
00409     return S_OK;
00410 }

00413 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00414 // Name: MsgProc()
00415 // Desc: Overrrides the main WndProc, so the sample can do custom message
00416 //       handling (e.g. processing mouse, keyboard, or menu commands).
00417 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00418 LRESULT CMyD3DApplication::MsgProc( HWND hWnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam,
00419                                     LPARAM lParam )
00420 {
00421     switch( msg )
00422     {
00423         case WM_PAINT:
00424         {
00425             if( m_bLoadingApp )
00426             {
00427                 // Draw on the window tell the user that the app is loading
00428                 // TODO: change as needed
00429                 HDC hDC = GetDC( hWnd );
00430                 TCHAR strMsg[MAX_PATH];
00431                 wsprintf( strMsg, TEXT("Loading... Please wait") );
00432                 RECT rct;
00433                 GetClientRect( hWnd, &rct );
00434                 DrawText( hDC, strMsg, -1, &rct, DT_CENTER|DT_VCENTER|DT_SINGLELINE );
00435                 ReleaseDC( hWnd, hDC );
00436             }
00437             break;
00438         }
00439 
00440         case WM_KEYDOWN:
00441                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00442                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnKeyDown(static_cast<const BYTE>(wParam));
00443             break;
00444 
00445         case WM_KEYUP:
00446                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00447                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnKeyUp(static_cast<const BYTE>(wParam));
00448             break;
00449 
00450                 case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00451                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00452                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnMouseMove(MAKEPOINTS(lParam));
00453                         break;
00454 
00455                 case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
00456                         SetCapture(hWnd);
00457                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00458                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnLButtonDown(MAKEPOINTS(lParam));
00459                         break;
00460 
00461                 case WM_LBUTTONUP:
00462                         SetCapture(NULL);
00463                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00464                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnLButtonUp(MAKEPOINTS(lParam));
00465                         break;
00466 
00467                 case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
00468                         SetCapture(hWnd);
00469                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00470                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnRButtonDown(MAKEPOINTS(lParam));
00471                         break;
00472 
00473                 case WM_RBUTTONUP:
00474                         SetCapture(NULL);
00475                         if (m_pScene && m_pScene->m_pMovementController)
00476                                 m_pScene->m_pMovementController->OnRButtonUp(MAKEPOINTS(lParam));
00477                         break;
00478 
00479     }
00480 
00481     return CD3DApplication::MsgProc( hWnd, msg, wParam, lParam );
00482 }

00494     m_pFont->InvalidateDeviceObjects();
00495 
00496     return S_OK;
00497 }

00502 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00503 // Name: DeleteDeviceObjects()
00504 // Desc: Paired with InitDeviceObjects()
00505 //       Called when the app is exiting, or the device is being changed,
00506 //       this function deletes any device dependent objects.  
00507 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00508 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::DeleteDeviceObjects()
00509 {
00510     // TODO: Cleanup any objects created in InitDeviceObjects()
00511     m_pFont->DeleteDeviceObjects();
00512         
00513         SAFE_DELETE(m_pScene);
00514     return S_OK;
00515 }

00520 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00521 // Name: FinalCleanup()
00522 // Desc: Paired with OneTimeSceneInit()
00523 //       Called before the app exits, this function gives the app the chance
00524 //       to cleanup after itself.
00525 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00526 HRESULT CMyD3DApplication::FinalCleanup()
00527 {
00528     // Cleanup D3D font
00529     SAFE_DELETE( m_pFont );
00530     SAFE_DELETE( m_pSoundManager );
00531 
00532         // Write the settings to the registry
00533     WriteSettings();
00534 
00535     return S_OK;
00536 }
